entry.title: Announcing Second Milestone Release of Finatra 2.0.0!
entry.content:
We’re pleased to announce the second milestone release of Finatra 2.0.0!

You can download the release from Maven Central.

For a full list of changes and updates see the diff here.

Features:

  • We’ve updated and added to the example projects including:
    • A Typesafe activator template for getting started with a Finatra project using Activator.
    • An example project that shows how to configure and run a Finatra application on Heroku.
    • An example Maven pom.xml in finatra-hello-world for building a Finatra application with Maven.

See the Finatra github page for more information on getting started.

– The Finatra Team

entry.title: Announcing First Milestone Release of Finatra 2.0.0 — ~50x Faster Than v1.6.0!
entry.content:
We’re pleased to announce the first milestone release of Finatra 2.0.0!

You can download the release from Maven Central.

Features:

  • Significant performance improvements over v1.6.0.
  • Powerful feature and integration test support.
  • JSR-330 Dependency Injection using Google Guice.
  • Jackson based JSON parsing with additional support for required fields, default values, and custom validations.
  • Logback MDC integration with com.twitter.util.Local for contextual logging across futures.

See the Finatra github page for more information on getting started.

– The Finatra Team

entry.title: Finatra 1.6.0 Released
entry.content:
Last release for 1.x.x and Scala 2.9

As we prepare for the upcoming 2.x.x release, this will be the last 1.x.x release and also the last release to be published for scala 2.9.x.

New Finatra and Maintainer!

I’m happy to announce that Steve Cosenza will be taking over the project for the 2.x.x release and beyond. We’re excited to release the next major iteration of Finatra and share everything we’ve learned using it in production at Twitter over the course of a year.

entry.title: Finatra 1.5.2 Released
entry.content:
Bootstrap and Bower built in

Finatra now generates a Bower compatible app with Bootstrap out of the box:

New Testing System

Write tests for just a Controller instead of an entire app:

class SampleController extends Controller {
  get(“/testing”) {
    request => render.plain(“hi”).toFuture
  }
}</p>

<p>“GET /testing” should “be 200” in {
  val app = MockApp(new SampleController)
  val response = app.get(“/testing”)</p>

<p>  response.code should be(200)
  response.body should be(“hi”)
}

See the Pull Request for more details.

entry.title: Finatra 1.5.1 Released
entry.content:
Response internals fix

It is now possible to modify the response “out of band”, since Response is tied to Request via request.response. For example, in a filter:

class ExampleFilter
  extends SimpleFilter[Request, Response] {



  def apply(
    request: FinagleRequest,
    service: Service[Request, Response])
  ) = {
    request.response.headers.add(“X-Filtered”, “True”)
    service(request)
  }



}

See RequestResponseSpec for more details.


Changelog

145981 Depend on finagle-stats, fixes #95
